pullrequest.title: Add //world/light to the sdf parsing stages and proposal as a sibling of //world/model

content.raw:
I think we both have disparate mental models that have not yet been disambiguated by our proposal.

I’ve always imagined that other elements that need to refer to frames use an equivalent scope as what links and joints use, even if they’re syntactically distinct \(e.g. collisions, visuals, sensors\). It seems like you want further distinction, though.

My preference is that we keep things simple - e.g. just use one bin of poses for `model` \(and I guess one bin for `world`\), but try not to add too many levels of scope at this moment? \(Let's defer disambiguation to the nesting proposal, which could retroactively handle the current simplicity?\)
